Common Reasons to Look for Help

There are many reasons to seek help from a psychologist, including, but not limited to:

You or others noticed that your child is feeling more tense, fearful, or anxious.
You and/or others noticed that your child lost interest in activities they used to enjoy.
Your childâ€™s energy level, sleep, appetite, or mood are different.
You or others notice that your child is having a hard time keeping up with school work, sports, and activities.
You and/or others notice your child responding in extreme ways to day-to-day situations, making it hard for your child to participate in activities.
Your child is facing a difficult life situation, including death of a loved one, traumatic or stressful event, or a change in family composition.
Your child has difficulties facing new and/or challenging situations or avoids doing tasks that are effortful.
Your child appears to have a hard time making or keeping friends, or gets into frequent fights with peers.

Keep in View

This is a part-time practice, your emails/voicemails will be returned within 48 hours.

If you or your child is in crisis or in need of immediate assistance, below are a list of supports you can reach:

  • Here 24/7: 1-844-437-3247
  • Closest Local Emergency Room
  • Mobile Crisis Unit Through Front Door at 519-749-2932
  • Canadian Mental Association
